pages.title: Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce HouseKit at a high level - what it is, its purpose as a modern ClickHouse ORM and CLI toolkit, and the key problems it solves

pages.title: Monorepo Structure
pages.purpose: Explain how the HouseKit monorepo is organized, including the packages, apps, and scripts directories, and how Turbo and Bun are used for orchestration

pages.title: Package Dependencies
pages.purpose: Document the dependency relationships between @housekit/orm and @housekit/kit, and how they interact with external dependencies like ClickHouse client

pages.title: @housekit/orm Package
pages.purpose: Introduction to the ORM package - its role as the high-performance core for ClickHouse interaction, key features like RowBinary serialization and type safety

pages.title: Installation and Setup
pages.purpose: Guide users through installing the ORM package, basic setup, and creating their first database client connection

pages.title: Schema Definition
pages.purpose: Comprehensive guide to defining tables, columns, and engines using defineTable, the 't' type utility, and ClickHouse engine configurations

pages.title: Client Management and Connections
pages.purpose: Explain createClient, multi-database support, connection configuration, and how the ORM loads config from housekit.config.ts

pages.title: Query Building
pages.purpose: Document the query builder API for SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE operations with type-safe DSL and SQL expression handling

pages.title: Relational Queries
pages.purpose: Deep dive into the Smart Relational API - how it uses groupArray for efficient one-to-many queries, join strategies, and nested relations

pages.title: Performance Optimizations
pages.purpose: Explain Turbo Mode (RowBinary serialization), background batching, binary encoders, and other performance features for high-throughput operations

pages.title: Advanced Features
pages.purpose: Cover dictionaries, materialized views, projections, and ClickHouse-specific features like ASOF JOIN and GLOBAL JOIN

pages.title: @housekit/kit CLI
pages.purpose: Introduction to the CLI tool - its role in schema management, migrations, and developer workflows for ClickHouse

pages.title: CLI Installation
pages.purpose: Guide for installing the CLI package and understanding its dependencies on the ORM

pages.title: Project Initialization
pages.purpose: Detailed walkthrough of the 'housekit init' command - what it creates, how it sets up project structure, and the example schema

pages.title: Configuration System
pages.purpose: Complete reference for housekit.config.ts - database connections, schema paths, environment variables, and multi-database setups

pages.title: Development Workflow (Push)
pages.purpose: Explain the rapid development workflow using 'housekit push' for instant schema synchronization, when to use it, and its features

pages.title: Production Workflow (Generate & Migrate)
pages.purpose: Document the controlled production workflow - 'housekit generate' for creating migrations, 'housekit migrate' for applying them, and snapshot.json

pages.title: CLI Commands Reference
pages.purpose: Comprehensive reference for all CLI commands - push, generate, migrate, pull, schema, status, validate, drop, truncate, reset, list, check

pages.title: Database Introspection
pages.purpose: Guide to using 'housekit pull' to generate TypeScript schemas from existing ClickHouse databases

pages.title: Cluster-Aware Operations
pages.purpose: Explain how HouseKit handles sharded ClickHouse clusters - onCluster configuration, {cluster} macros, and distributed operations

pages.title: Blue-Green Migrations
pages.purpose: Detail the blue-green deployment strategy for zero-downtime schema changes, especially for materialized views

pages.title: CI/CD and Release Management
pages.purpose: Overview of HouseKit's automation infrastructure for publishing packages and managing versions

pages.title: Publishing Workflow
pages.purpose: Explain the GitHub Actions workflow for automated package publishing to npm, including triggers and the publish-if-new script

pages.title: Version Management
pages.purpose: Document the bump-changed-versions script - how it detects changes, calculates version bumps, handles dependency chains, and updates package.json files
